<div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:GUCCI%E3%81%A8%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B3%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9C_(8396359459).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/GUCCI%E3%81%A8%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B3%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9C_%288396359459%29.jpg/220px-GUCCI%E3%81%A8%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B3%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9C_%288396359459%29.jpg" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/GUCCI%E3%81%A8%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B3%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9C_%288396359459%29.jpg/330px-GUCCI%E3%81%A8%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B3%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9C_%288396359459%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/GUCCI%E3%81%A8%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B3%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9C_%288396359459%29.jpg/440px-GUCCI%E3%81%A8%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B3%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9C_%288396359459%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4896" data-file-height="3264" /></a>
<div class="thumbcaption">
<div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:GUCCI%E3%81%A8%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A7%E3%81%AE%E3%82%B3%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9C_(8396359459).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>
A Gucci store display in 2013, featuring <i>JoJo's Bizarre Adventure</i> characters.</div>
</div>
</div>
<p>From September 17 to October 6, 2011, the <a href="/wiki/Gucci" title="Gucci">Gucci</a> store in <a href="/wiki/Shinjuku,_Tokyo" title="Shinjuku, Tokyo" class="mw-redirect">Shinjuku</a> hosted the Gucci x Hirohiko Araki x Spur "Rohan Kishibe Goes to Gucci" Exhibition, a collaboration between the luxury Italian clothing brand, Araki, and the Japanese fashion magazine <i>Spur</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-Gucci_86-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Gucci-86"><span>[</span>86<span>]</span></a></sup> The exhibit celebrated the 90th anniversary of Gucci and featured a life-size figure of Rohan Kishibe, as well as numerous illustrations by Araki; including actual pieces of the brand's own 2011-2012 fall/winter collection and his own original fashion designs.<sup id="cite_ref-Gucci_86-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Gucci-86"><span>[</span>86<span>]</span></a></sup> The October 2011 issue of <i>Spur</i> featured another one-shot manga titled <i>Rohan Kishibe Goes to Gucci</i> <span style="font-weight: normal">(<span class="t_nihongo_kanji" lang="ja">Â≤∏Ëæ∫Èú≤‰º¥ „Ç∞„ÉÉ„ÉÅ„Å∏Ë°å„Åè</span><span class="t_nihongo_comma" style="display:none">,</span> <i>Kishibe Rohan Guchi e Yuku</i>)</span>, in which Rohan goes to a Gucci factory to discover the secret behind a magical handbag with the characters wearing and using Gucci products.<sup id="cite_ref-87" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-87"><span>[</span>87<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88"><span>[</span>88<span>]</span></a></sup> This was followed by another collaboration in the February 2013 issue of <i>Spur</i> with <i>Jolyne, Fly High with Gucci</i> <span style="font-weight: normal">(<span class="t_nihongo_kanji" lang="ja">ÂæêÂÄ´„ÄÅGUCCI„ÅßÈ£õ„Å∂</span><span class="t_nihongo_comma" style="display:none">,</span> <i>Jorƒ´n, Gutchi de Tobu</i>)</span>, starring <a href="/wiki/Jolyne_Cujoh" title="Jolyne Cujoh" class="mw-redirect">Jolyne Cujoh</a> from Part 6.<sup id="cite_ref-Jolyne_89-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jolyne-89"><span>[</span>89<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-natalie1_90-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-natalie1-90"><span>[</span>90<span>]</span></a></sup> A free English translation of the latter was previously available on Gucci's Facebook page. Again, Araki's artwork was featured in Gucci's storefront displays around the world.<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91"><span>[</span>91<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92"><span>[</span>92<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="25th_anniversary">25th anniversary</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=JoJo%27s_Bizarre_Adventure&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: 25th anniversary">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>There were several art exhibitions in 2012 in Japan for the manga's 25th anniversary. The first was in Araki's birthplace of <a href="/wiki/Sendai" title="Sendai">Sendai</a>, which included a <a href="/wiki/Lawson_(store)" title="Lawson (store)">Lawson</a> store remodeled to look like the "Owson" store that appears in <i>Diamond Is Unbreakable</i> and <i>JoJolion</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93"><span>[</span>93<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94"><span>[</span>94<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95"><span>[</span>95<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-96"><span>[</span>96<span>]</span></a></sup> The store was opened from July 28 to September 30, and contained exclusive goods with the Owson name. The second exhibition was held in Tokyo from October 6 to November 4 and hangouts were held on <a href="/wiki/Google_Plus" title="Google Plus" class="mw-redirect">Google Plus</a> to allow fans to view the gallery at night through the lens of Remote Romance <span style="font-weight: normal">(<span class="t_nihongo_kanji" lang="ja">„É™„É¢„Éº„Éà„É≠„Éû„É≥„Çπ</span><span class="t_nihongo_comma" style="display:none">,</span> <i>Rim≈çto Romansu</i>)</span>, an original "Stand" Araki and his team created for the event.<sup id="cite_ref-ex_1_97-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ex_1-97"><span>[</span>97<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-98"><span>[</span>98<span>]</span></a></sup> The exhibit was taken to Italy from June 28 to July 14, 2013 and shown at the Gucci showroom in <a href="/wiki/Florence" title="Florence">Florence</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-ex_1_97-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ex_1-97"><span>[</span>97<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ex_2_99-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ex_2-99"><span>[</span>99<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>The October 2012 issue of <i>Ultra Jump</i> contained a special booklet titled <i>25 Years With JoJo</i>, also in celebration of the anniversary, featuring messages and tribute art from well-known manga artists such as <a href="/wiki/Akira_Toriyama" title="Akira Toriyama">Akira Toriyama</a>, <a href="/wiki/Yoshihiro_Togashi" title="Yoshihiro Togashi">Yoshihiro Togashi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Eiichiro_Oda" title="Eiichiro Oda">Eiichiro Oda</a>, <a href="/wiki/Clamp_(manga_artists)" title="Clamp (manga artists)">Clamp</a>, and 18 others.<sup id="cite_ref-Episode5_25-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Episode5-25"><span>[</span>25<span>]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100"><span>[</span>100<span>]</span></a></sup> During the 25th anniversary celebrations, a special smartphone with a <i>JoJo's Bizarre Adventure</i> inspired UI was released.<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101"><span>[</span>101<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>To celebrate the release of the <i>All Star Battle</i> video game, created for the 25th anniversary, a special JoJo-themed train traveled the <a href="/wiki/Yamanote_Line" title="Yamanote Line">Yamanote Line</a> in Tokyo from August 29 to September 9, 2013. Illustrations and advertisements of the series littered the interior, with videos of the game shown on displays, while the exterior had 33 characters as livery.<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-102"><span>[</span>102<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=JoJo%27s_Bizarre_Adventure&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<li id="cite_note-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-14">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://natalie.mu/comic/news/99692">"„Ç≥„Éü„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Éä„Çø„É™„Éº - „Äå„Ç∏„Éß„Ç∏„Éß„Äç„Ç´„É©„Éº„Éö„Éº„Ç∏„ÇíÂÆåÂÖ®ÂÜçÁèæ„Åó„Åü„ÄåJoJonium„ÄçÂàäË°å"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Natalie.mu" title="Natalie.mu" class="mw-redirect">Natalie.mu</a>. </ol>
</div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=JoJo%27s_Bizarre_Adventure&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: External links">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="noprint portal tright" style="border:solid #aaa 1px;margin:0.5em 0 0.5em 1em">
<table style="background:#f9f9f9;font-size:85%;line-height:110%;max-width:175px">
<tr style="vertical-align:middle">
<td style="text-align:center"><a href="/wiki/File:Wikipe-tan_face.svg" class="image"><img alt="Portal icon" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Wikipe-tan_face.svg/28px-Wikipe-tan_face.svg.png" width="28" height="28" class="noviewer" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Wikipe-tan_face.svg/42px-Wikipe-tan_face.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Wikipe-tan_face.svg/56px-Wikipe-tan_face.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="440" data-file-height="440" /></a></td>
<td style="padding:0 0.2em;vertical-align:middle;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold"><a href="/wiki/Portal:Anime_and_manga" title="Portal:Anime and manga" class="mw-redirect">Anime and manga portal</a></td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<table class="mbox-small plainlinks sistersitebox" style="border:1px solid #aaa;background-color:#f9f9f9">
<tr>
<td class="mbox-image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/30px-Commons-logo.svg.png" width="30" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/45px-Commons-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/59px-Commons-logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="1376" /></td>
<td class="mbox-text plainlist">Wikimedia Commons has media related to <i><b><a href="//commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:JoJo%27s_Bizarre_Adventure" class="extiw" title="commons:Category:JoJo's Bizarre Adventure">JoJo's Bizarre Adventure</a></b></i>.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<ul>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.araki-jojo.com/">Official website</a> <span class="languageicon" style="font-size:0.95em; font-weight:bold; color:#555;">(Japanese)</span></li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://wwws.warnerbros.co.jp/jojo-animation/">Official anime website</a> <span class="languageicon" style="font-size:0.95em; font-weight:bold; color:#555;">(Japanese)</span></li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.viz.com/manga/print/jojos-bizarre-adventure-part-1-phantom-blood"><i>JoJo's Bizarre Adventure</i></a> at <a href="/wiki/Viz_Media" title="Viz Media">Viz Media</a></li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/manga.php?id=1900"><i>JoJo's Bizarre Adventure</i></a> (manga) at <a href="/wiki/Anime_News_Network" title="Anime News Network">Anime News Network</a>'s encyclopedia</li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://annex.s-manga.net/jojo/">The World of JoJo</a> Flash movie presentations that quickly summarize each arc in <i>JoJo</i>. <span class="languageicon" style="font-size:0.95em; font-weight:bold; color:#555;">(Japanese)</span></li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://atmarkjojo.org/archives/2003/2003-08-22-000071.html">Evidence of <i>JoJo'</i>s spelling errors</a> <span class="languageicon" style="font-size:0.95em; font-weight:bold; color:#555;">(Japanese)</span></li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.sonic.net/~jason/jojo.html">The JoJo FAQ, with plot and character summaries</a></li>
</ul>

<tr>
<th scope="row" class="navbox-group">Novelizations</th>
<td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
<div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<ul>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Death_Note_Another_Note:_The_Los_Angeles_BB_Murder_Cases" title="Death Note Another Note: The Los Angeles BB Murder Cases">Death Note Another Note: The Los Angeles BB Murder Cases</a></i></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/XxxHolic#Other" title="XxxHolic">xxxHolic, Another Holic Landolt-Ring Aerosol</a></i></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/JoJo%27s_Bizarre_Adventure#Novels" title="JoJo's Bizarre Adventure">JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Over Heaven</a></i></li>
</ul>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr style="height:2px">
<td colspan="2"></td>
</tr>
